controller

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.Controller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observer

    public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
implements Observer
    This class is the controller between the views and models, passing data back and forth via a Observer Pattern.
    Author:
    Anthony

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Controller(MainContainer view)
      Constructor that attaches the main view (of the MVC) to it.

    • Method Detail

      • updates

        public void updates(java.lang.Object args)
        Specified by:
        updates in interface Observer

      • addStock

        public void addStock()
        Creates a filechooser and allows the user to select some stock.csv. If the file is not found the program simply discards the FNFException. Otherwise it is added to the necesary views.

      • removeStock

        public void removeStock(CSVObj obj)
        Removes any given CSVObj object. Currently not implemented.
        Parameters:
        obj - The CSVObj to remove.

      • createGraph

        public void createGraph(CSVObj obj)
        Creates a graph for the most recent year of a given CSVObj.
        Parameters:
        obj - The CSVObj to graph the most recent year of.

      • createGraph

        public void createGraph(CSVInterval csv)
        Creates a graph for the most recent year of a given CSVInterval.
        Parameters:
        csv - The CSVInterval (filled with a proper CSVObj parent) to graph.

      • graphInterval

        public void graphInterval(IntervalNode intervalNode)
        This will create a graph given two specific dates via the IntervalNode class. If no dates are selected then it will assume the whole entire dataset. If one date is selected it will go from there to the most recent.
        Parameters:
        intervalNode - IntervalNode to get the interval from.

      • graphPrompt

        public void graphPrompt()
        The method to be called when an interval is wanted to be created
        See Also:
        IntervalNode
